sentences: Ta saab alati oma töö teha.
context: The word 'saad' in Estonian is the second person singular form of the verb 'saa-' meaning 'to get' or 'to be able to'. It's commonly used when asking if someone gets/receives something or when stating what someone is able to do. In questions, it often asks about capability or permission (e.g., 'Can you help me?'), while in statements it indicates ability or the act of receiving.
